name: Socat
description: Socat is a command line based utility that establishes two bidirectional byte streams and transfers data between them. Because the streams can be constructed from a large set of different data sinks and sources (like files, pipes, devices, or sockets), socat can be used for a myriad of tasks in a wide variety of situations. Socat is often compared to netcat but with more extensive features. It is commonly used for debugging, testing, and as a network debugging tool. Socat can be employed for creating ad-hoc secure connections using SSH, redirecting TCP traffic over a relay, and also to set up listening sockets which can be a security risk if misconfigured.
